before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"cm8n6","text":"Before starting, generate the \"odd\" and \"even\" primer pools as follows:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ci7om","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7gq6m","text":"1. Fully resuspend lyophilised oligonucleotides in 1x TE to a concentration of 100 micromolar (µM) , vortex thoroughly and spin down ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1l164","text":"2. Sort the odd and even primer sets into separate batches and label two 1.5-ml tubes ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4vk8","text":"3. Starting with the even primer set add the volume (μl) given overleaf to the pooled 1.5-ml tube (between 7.5 - 15). Repeat with the odds. Vortex and spin down. These are your pooled stocks. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3cr0c","text":"4. Dilute the pools one in ten across several aliquots with molecular grade water. Vortex and spin down. These are your working primer pools.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":141,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"573ek","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"file","mutability":"","data":{"forceSelection":true,"guid":"63C49E80414D11ECA911C19A51EC71BF","id":184516,"nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"SubArtic primers v3-2 091121.csv","placeholder":"","raw_source":"","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fwge45nn.csv"}}}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"8rluo","text":"This protocol describes a procedure for sequencing the Spike region of SARS-CoV-2 using short amplicons (146-208bp). The method has proved to successful with both clinical RNA samples and degraded wastewater samples. The primers are unique to this method. The library prep procedure has been heavily adapted from the ncov-2019 sequencing v3 (ARTIC) protocol by Josh Quick (https://www.protocols.io/view/ncov-2019-sequencing-protocol-v3-locost-bh42j8ye) and the \"low cost\" method from the NEOF Liverpool Illumina ARTIC protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":373,"length":78}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"5BFC52C1421A11ECA9C70A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.protocols.io/view/ncov-2019-sequencing-protocol-v3-locost-bh42j8ye"}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6u0s8","text":"Primers are separated into two pools, odd and even, depending on where they sit across the Spike region. See the guidelines section for further details.
